poem:
### Misguided Currents

In the glow of cathode light,  
George Clarke guides through construct's sleight,  
As greens whisper their promise,  
cogged gears turn toward persuasion.  
Spaces blur in mercurial sheen,  
a mislead tale in frames between,  
Where truth tangles with showbiz rhyme,  
and trust spirals in ad-time chime.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The promotion ran on the same channel as the show, during its ad breaks, and opened with the text “George Clarke’s amazing green spaces” in the same font and style as the real programme. Clarke then appeared,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
